thread.title: IMF head: Global growth likely to be weak
thread.title_full: IMF head: Global growth likely to be weak

title: IMF head: Global growth likely to be weak
text:
View Photo 

Global economic growth is likely to be weaker than earlier expected and will remain at moderate levels, the head of the International Monetary Fund says. 
IMF Managing Director Christine Lagarde said on Tuesday that Asia was still expected to lead global growth, but the pace was slowing and could sag further because of recent financial market volatility. 
Speaking in a lecture at the University of Indonesia, Lagarde said the global economic situation would have a significant impact on developing countries, including Indonesia. 
"Overall, we expect global growth to remain moderate and likely weaker than we anticipated in July," Lagarde said. 
"This reflects ... a weaker-than-expected recovery in advanced economies and a further slowdown in emerging economies, especially Latin America." 
Lagarde said emerging economies including Indonesia needed to be vigilant in handling the potential spillover from China's slowdown and the tightening of global financial conditions. 
Indonesia's growth has been slowing for the past four years, and has recently fallen below 5 per cent for the first time since the global financial crisis. 
Lagarde, who is on a two-day visit to Indonesia, met with President Joko "Jokowi" Widodo on Tuesday and discussed the global economic situation. 
Speculation that Indonesia is seeking loans from the IMF has been denied by both sides. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook
